page.title: 13Loventor Manor Hotel
page.content: The Hotel is called "Loventor" because it came from the name "Coventor", but over the years the {C}has changed to {L.}It was called "Coventor" because some of the houses were built by a rocky or stoney cove. The Manor is mentioned in the original Domesday Book and twenty two years ago became a hotel. Roughly 1000 people stay at the hotel each year and Anne Weston the owner, also owns some 500 acres of land. The hotel offers entertainment such as trout fishing, music and clay pigeon shooting. The hotel can sleep 24 people and the charge is Â£23 daily per person. It is often used as a conference centre as well as a place for wedding receptions. We went in some of the rooms, they are old fashioned with no plastic at all.
